issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
$mapred  mradmin  
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/hadoop/mapred/tools/MRAdmin
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.hadoop.mapred.tools.MRAdmin
        at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202)
        at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
        at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:307)
        at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:248)
Could not find the main class: org.apache.hadoop.mapred.tools.MRAdmin.  Program will exit.
fields.summary: "mapred mradmin" command is broken in mrv2

comments.body:
This is what I get

<noformat>
$ mapred mradmin -refreshQueues
2011-11-14 11:18:10,962 INFO  [main] ipc.Client (Client.java:handleConnectionFailure(671)) - Retrying connect to server: localhost.localdomain:192.168.1.2:50030. Already tried 0 time(s).
2011-11-14 11:18:11,969 INFO  [main] ipc.Client (Client.java:handleConnectionFailure(671)) - Retrying connect to server: localhost.localdomain:192.168.1.2:50030. Already tried 1 time(s).
2011-11-14 11:18:12,990 INFO  [main] ipc.Client (Client.java:handleConnectionFailure(671)) - Retrying connect to server: localhost.localdomain:192.168.1.2:50030. Already tried 2 time(s).
2011-11-14 11:18:13,993 INFO  [main] ipc.Client (Client.java:handleConnectionFailure(671)) - Retrying connect to server: localhost.localdomain:192.168.1.2:50030. Already tried 3 time(s).
2011-11-14 11:18:15,081 INFO  [main] ipc.Client (Client.java:handleConnectionFailure(671)) - Retrying connect to server: localhost.localdomain:192.168.1.2:50030. Already tried 4 time(s).
2011-11-14 11:18:16,209 INFO  [main] ipc.Client (Client.java:handleConnectionFailure(671)) - Retrying connect to server: localhost.localdomain:192.168.1.2:50030. Already tried 5 time(s).
2011-11-14 11:18:17,212 INFO  [main] ipc.Client (Client.java:handleConnectionFailure(671)) - Retrying connect to server: localhost.localdomain:192.168.1.2:50030. Already tried 6 time(s).
2011-11-14 11:18:18,215 INFO  [main] ipc.Client (Client.java:handleConnectionFailure(671)) - Retrying connect to server: localhost.localdomain:192.168.1.2:50030. Already tried 7 time(s).
2011-11-14 11:18:19,218 INFO  [main] ipc.Client (Client.java:handleConnectionFailure(671)) - Retrying connect to server: localhost.localdomain:192.168.1.2:50030. Already tried 8 time(s).
2011-11-14 11:18:20,221 INFO  [main] ipc.Client (Client.java:handleConnectionFailure(671)) - Retrying connect to server: localhost.localdomain:192.168.1.2:50030. Already tried 9 time(s).
refreshQueues: Call From localhost.localdomain:192.168.1.2 to localhost.localdomain:50030 failed on connection exception: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused; For more details see:  http://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/ConnectionRefused
<noformat>

Hi,
Even I have run into this problem.Then I had to add the hadoop-mapreduce-0.24.0-SNAPSHOT.jar (generated by ant) to the classpath for resolving it. This jar is not part of the distribution now, should we consider adding it back to the ditribution?

As I understand it, the mradmin command doesn't apply in mrv2.  The closest equivalent is the yarn rmadmin command.  Also the tasktracker and jobtracker commands don't make sense in mrv2.  Shall we just remove these commands from the help message and potentially point people towards the yarn shell command if they try to use them?

As for the ant-generated jar that does contain the mradmin, I believe that jar was generated for some legacy MR tests that haven't been ported to mrv2 yet.  I don't think that jar is intended to be released with the distribution.
Patch removes mradmin/tasktracker/jobtracker from mapred usage output, provides pointer to the yarn command if those commands are given to mapred.
+1, this is good. Very helpful for folks upgrading to mrv2.

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12510906/MAPREDUCE-3194.patch
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1619//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/1619//console

This message is automatically generated.

No test since simply removing extra output from usage statement.  Manually verified by running mapred command without arguments to see the usage statement and by running mapred mradmin, mapred tasktracker, and mapred jobtracker to verify the pointer to yarn is printed.
Thanks Jason, I just merged this to Trunk and 0.23.

Integrated in Hadoop-Hdfs-0.23-Commit #410 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-Hdfs-0.23-Commit/410/])
    merge MAPREDUCE-3194
